academic_experience.location: La Jolla, San Diego, CA, USA
details: Investigate how to improve generative models with contextual multimodal documents to aid designers and explore their use in human collaborations.

academic_experience.location: La Jolla, San Diego, CA, USA
details: Combine neural methods and traditional graphics pipelines to enable flexible and fast-forward physical interaction prediction.
Study inverse physical prediction using diffusion-based models.

academic_experience.location: La Jolla, San Diego, CA, USA
details: Develop and implement GraphHSCN, a novel graph neural network architecture for long-range interaction in graph-structured data.
Presented the senior capstone and HDSI scholarship poster session on GraphHSCN.

academic_experience.location: La Jolla, San Diego, CA, USA
details: Contributed to the development and analysis of Physion under Prof. Judith Fan.
Focused on data analysis and designing 3D stimuli for evaluating physical understanding in vision models compared to human perception.
Built data infrastructure for product analytics and machine learning algorithms using Firestore.
Conducted marketing data analytics to identify key user groups.
Designed survey models for user feedback.
Developed lossless image compression solutions, saving ~20% annual image storage.
Built end-to-end process-agnostic advanced statistical tools with automatic alerts.
Conducted root cause analysis and validated model performance.

working_experience.location: La Jolla, San Diego, CA, USA
details: Used Ray Tune for scalable multi-GPU hyperparameter tuning.
Investigated data-centric MLOps solutions for experimentation efficiency.

projects.name: Tree-of-thoughts Context-aware Encoding for LLMs
projects.location: La Jolla, San Diego, CA, USA
details: Led the development of a context-aware encoding algorithm for LLMs.
Improved knowledge retrieval accuracy without model fine-tuning using hierarchical context trees.

projects.name: GraphHSCN
details: Designed and implemented GraphHSCN for long-range interaction in graph data.
Presented work at HDSI scholarship poster sessions.
